info.name: Emergency Response API
info.description:
Comprehensive Emergency Response API Collection organized by features and user roles

**User Roles:**
üî¥ ADMIN - Full system access
üîµ RELAWAN - Emergency responders
üü¢ USER - Regular citizens
üë§ ALL ROLES - All authenticated users

item.name: üîê 1. Authentication & Profile
item.description: User registration, login, and profile management for all user types

request.description:
**Access:** üë§ PUBLIC
**Purpose:** Register new user account for emergency services
**User Type:** Citizens creating accounts

**Response includes:**
- User details
- Authentication token
- Role assignment

**Access:** üë§ PUBLIC
**Purpose:** Authenticate users to access emergency services
**User Type:** All registered users

**Auto-saves token to environment variable for other requests**

**Access:** üë§ ALL ROLES
**Purpose:** Get current user profile information
**User Type:** Any authenticated user

**Returns:**
- User details
- Role information
- Account status

**Access:** üë§ ALL ROLES
**Purpose:** Update user profile information
**User Type:** Users updating their own profile
**Restriction:** Users can only update their own profile

**Access:** üë§ PUBLIC
**Purpose:** Refresh authentication token
**User Type:** All authenticated users

**Use Case:** Maintain session without re-login

**Access:** üë§ ALL ROLES
**Purpose:** Secure session termination
**User Type:** Any authenticated user

**Effect:** Invalidates current token

item.name: üì∏ 3. Photo Reports

request.description:

item.name: üö® 4. Emergency Panic Button
item.description: Critical emergency reporting system with real-time GPS tracking

request.description:
**Access:** üü¢ USER
**Purpose:** Report immediate emergencies requiring urgent response
**User Type:** Citizens in emergency situations

**‚ö° CRITICAL FEATURES:**
- GPS location automatically captured
- Instantly assigned to on-duty relawan
- Real-time notifications sent
- Creates trackable incident ID

**System Response:**
1. Captures exact timestamp
2. Identifies relawan on duty
3. Auto-assigns emergency
4. Sends immediate alerts

**Access:** üë§ ALL ROLES
**Purpose:** View current day emergency incidents
**User Type & Access:**
- üü¢ Users: Only their own panic reports
- üîµ Relawan: Reports assigned during their shifts
- üî¥ Admins: All panic reports

**Returns:** Real-time emergency status for today

**Access:** üîµ RELAWAN + üî¥ ADMIN
**Purpose:** Track progress of emergency response
**User Type:** Emergency responders and supervisors

**Status Options:**
- `pending` - Initial state, waiting for response
- `in_progress` - Relawan responding to scene
- `resolved` - Emergency successfully handled

**Use Case:** Real-time emergency tracking and coordination

**Use Case:** Emergency management dashboard

**‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING:** Use only for confirmed false alarms

**Returns:**

- Availability status
- Current emergency assignments
- Coverage analysis

item.name: üìÖ 7. Admin - Shift Management
item.description: Pattern-based shift scheduling system for relawan (ADMIN ONLY)

request.description:
**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Monitor current and upcoming shift assignments
**User Type:** Administrators managing shift schedules

**Returns:**
- Daily shift schedules
- Assigned relawan per shift
- Coverage analysis
- Upcoming shift gaps
- Schedule conflicts

**Use Case:** Shift oversight and management dashboard

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Modify specific shift details
**User Type:** Administrators adjusting schedules

**Modifiable:**
- Assigned relawan
- Active status

**Use Cases:**
- Emergency schedule changes
- Relawan substitutions
- Status adjustments

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Cancel entire day's shifts
**User Type:** Administrators managing special circumstances

**Format:** YYYY-MM-DD
**Use Cases:**
- Public holidays
- Emergency situations
- System maintenance days

**‚ö†Ô∏è Note:** Cancels ALL shifts for the specified date

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Remove specific relawan from shifts by name
**User Type:** Administrators managing relawan availability

**Parameters:**
- relawan_name (required)
- date_from (optional)
- date_to (optional)

**Use Cases:**
- Relawan resignation
- Extended leave
- Disciplinary actions

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Remove specific relawan from shifts by ID
**User Type:** Administrators with precise relawan identification

**More reliable than name-based deletion**
**Use when you have exact relawan ID**

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** üéØ KEY FUNCTION - Generate actual shifts from defined patterns
**User Type:** Administrators creating monthly schedules

**‚ö° CORE SYSTEM FEATURE:**
This is the main function that creates actual shift schedules from your weekly patterns!

**Process:**
1. Takes your weekly patterns (Monday = Relawan A+B, etc.)
2. Applies them to the specified date range
3. Creates individual daily shifts
4. Repeats weekly pattern throughout the period

**Parameters:**
- start_date: Beginning of schedule period
- end_date: End of schedule period  
- overwrite_existing: Replace existing shifts?

**Example:** Generate June 2025 shifts using current weekly patterns

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Get list of available relawan for shift assignment
**User Type:** Administrators creating shift assignments

**Returns:**
- Available relawan list
- Contact information
- Specializations
- Current availability status

**Use Case:** Support for shift assignment interfaces

item.name: üìã 8. Admin - Pattern Management
item.description: Create and manage weekly shift patterns - CORE SYSTEM FEATURE (ADMIN ONLY)

request.description:
**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** View current weekly pattern configurations
**User Type:** Administrators managing shift templates

**üîë CORE CONCEPT - Weekly Pattern Templates:**
Patterns define who works on which day of the week. These templates are then used to generate actual monthly schedules.

**Returns:**
- Monday patterns (which relawan)
- Tuesday patterns, Wednesday patterns, etc.
- Complete weekly template overview

**Use Case:** Review current weekly schedule template before generating monthly shifts

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** üéØ CORE FUNCTION - Define shift pattern for specific day
**User Type:** Administrators creating weekly templates

**‚ö° KEY SYSTEM FEATURE:**
This defines your weekly schedule template!

**Day Numbers:**
- 1 = Monday
- 2 = Tuesday  
- 3 = Wednesday
- 4 = Thursday
- 5 = Friday
- 6 = Saturday
- 7 = Sunday

**Example:** Set Monday pattern with Relawan 1, 3, 5

**Process:**
1. Define which relawan work on specific day
2. This pattern repeats every week when generating shifts

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Add additional relawan to existing day pattern
**User Type:** Administrators expanding coverage

**Use Cases:**
- Add backup relawan to busy days
- Increase coverage for high-risk periods
- Add specialized relawan for specific days

**Example:** Add Relawan 4 to Tuesday pattern

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Remove relawan from specific day pattern
**User Type:** Administrators adjusting coverage

**Use Cases:**
- Remove relawan from overloaded days
- Adjust for relawan availability changes
- Rebalance weekly workload

**Example:** Remove Relawan 2 from Wednesday pattern

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Enable/disable specific pattern without deleting
**User Type:** Administrators managing pattern status

**Use Cases:**
- Temporarily disable patterns for holidays
- Test different pattern configurations
- Seasonal schedule adjustments

**Benefit:** Keep patterns for future use without active application

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Clear all patterns for specific day of week
**User Type:** Administrators resetting day configurations

**Day Numbers:** 1=Monday, 7=Sunday

**Use Cases:**
- Make Sunday a complete rest day
- Reset day configuration to start over
- Remove all assignments for specific weekday

**Example URL shows:** Clear all Sunday (day 7) patterns

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** Get detailed pattern for specific day of week
**User Type:** Administrators reviewing day configurations

**Day Numbers:** 1=Monday through 7=Sunday

**Returns:**
- All relawan assigned to this day
- Pattern status (active/inactive)

**Example URL shows:** Get Monday (day 1) pattern details

**Access:** üî¥ ADMIN ONLY
**Purpose:** üéØ EFFICIENCY FEATURE - Set multiple day patterns at once
**User Type:** Administrators creating complete weekly schedules

**‚ö° BULK OPERATION:**
Configure entire weekly pattern in one request!

**Benefits:**
- Set up complete weekly schedule efficiently
- Ensure consistent coverage across days
- Reduce API calls for pattern setup

**Example Creates:**
- Monday: Relawan 1,2
- Tuesday: Relawan 3,4  
- Wednesday: Relawan 1,5

**Best Practice:** Use this for initial weekly pattern setup
